name: contact
description: The contact table contains details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

id.name: id
id.title: Id
id.description: The identifier for the contact. Each contact must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Id
location_id.description: The identifier for the location_id when the location of the contact is relevant.

title.name: title
title.title: Title
title.description: The job title of the contact.

department.name: department
department.title: Department
department.description: The department that the contact is a part of.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the contact.

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: The services attributes table creates a link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata table contains a record of the changes that have been made to the data in order to maintain provenance information.
